title: Favourite place on Runeterra that isn't a region and why?
body: Icathia for me, the only good choice ;) Amazing rebel state of Shurima with rich culture and loyal citizens. Also Jax and Zilean!!

replies.body:
You’re just tring to find a reason to hype up Icathia aren’t you? : P 

Jokes aside, probably the Immortal Bastion. It has a long history, once belonging to the fearsome Mordekaiser, it’s where Swain got his demon, the symbol of might for Noxus. Plus the architecture is really cool.

The Cultivairs in the depths of Zaun.

Ever since we got artwork for them, I want to explore them more. Maybe a story in which someone is meeting a Chembaroness in a cultivair she inhabits.
They look beautiful and considering how cruel, polluted and dark Zaun usually is, these buildings make a great contrast for that. They look peaceful, they are an oasis of nature deep inside a city ruled by steel and glass.

Hopefully we can experience their atmosphere through a comic or story some time in the future.

I think the sheer mystery surrounding the Isles is a huge part of what makes it so fascinating. Not to mention how technologically and culturally advanced they seem to have been for a society that existed so many years before the current time.

It kind of is Capital right now- there are two capitals technicaly speaking. "Real" and "Fake".

**"Uoroboros" shortstory quote:**
_“Emperor Xerath sends offerings. We are to be your servants. He welcomes you to his new capital at Nerimazeth.”_

Power is illusion. The ruler is who people choose to be one, not somebody of what you call 'royal blood', therefore Xerath, as person chosen by some people is technicaly speaking, a leader on specific teritory and grows from there in oposition to Azir, while Azir is God knows where exacly, doing God knows what and is generaly untrusted by population of shurimians like Sivir, Taliyah and other citizens. Hell even Nasus has no idea what Azir is doing with his life and is on Azirs side out of pure spite! Because he hates and fears Xerath! 

**"Bloodline" story quote:**
_“What does Azir want with her?” asked Taliyah. “And what is he going to do now that he’s back? Does he want to make us slaves?”
“She asks a lot of questions,” said Sivir.
Nasus hesitated before answering.
“In truth, I do not know what Azir plans. That he will stand against Xerath is enough for me. Now you can both meekly bare your necks, or you can live to fight another day.”_

Thats kind of immoral of Nasus(?). At least i get this impression. He acknowledges: "Oh shit. I really fucked up bad and Im scared of that dude. The other one might be warlord and slavery enforcer (what we players know isnt true, at least second part of the statement, but in the universe onone knows except of Xerath) but if he will stand with me against the guy who apparently is doing pretty well and wanted to forgive me for wrecking him mentaly, im okay with it since im badass God warrior and my status will stay untouched."

And Xerath, reminding first quote, was eager to forgive Nasus (who tehnicaly Burried Him Alive trapping him in a coffin without a single hesitation when Xerath wasnt stated to be agressive at all and later imprisoned him in magicaly sealed tomb in which he was rotting in the darkness and silence for millenia and almost lost his mind from stumiuli defficency) and accept him in his new organised society in Nerizameth.

What kind of leadership is that what Azir represents? Curently Xerath is more of a emperor with his acolites and capital. He is at least doing something. Interacting with outside world, bringing people together, while "real" capital has ghostlike hidden "emperor" and is attracting people mostly beacuse WATER OMG WATER!
